observation: I can see the Specter.AI website with a sign-up form. There are email and password input fields visible, along with a 'Next' button. As an elderly user, I need to start filling out the registration form. The form appears to have good contrast and the text seems reasonably sized.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user wanting to create an account, I should start by entering my email address in the email field. This is the logical first step in the sign-up process.
ux_issues: The form elements appear to be positioned quite far down the page which may require scrolling for elderly users

outcome.visual_observation: UX issues detected: The form elements appear to be positioned quite far down the page which may require scrolling for elderly users
outcome.diagnosis: Analysis completed - see evidence for details

issues: The form elements appear to be positioned quite far down the page which may require scrolling for elderly users

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: Email input field successfully populated with 'ai.test.user@example.com'. The form now shows a filled email field and maintains the password field with masked characters. The 'Next' button and 'Sign in' link remain visible and accessible.
